message.content:
1. Seven women presented with corneal NV.
2. Nine men presented with corneal NV.
3. The average age of the patients is 51 years.
4. The corneal NV is secondary to various conditions.
5. Seven cases of corneal NV are due to herpetic keratitis.
6. Six cases of corneal NV are due to graft rejection.
7. One case of corneal NV is due to a chemical burn.
8. One case of corneal NV is due to pemphigoid.
9. One case of corneal NV is due to a recurrent ulcer.

messages.content:
Statement: Seven women and nine men, with an average age of 51 years, presented with corneal NV secondary to herpetic keratitis (7 cases), graft rejection (6), chemical burn (1), pemphigoid (1), and recurrent ulcer (1).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
